SENT.plain: A 5-year-old girl developed cardiopulmonary arrest after crying

From the electrocardiogram and echocardiography, a left ventricular noncompaction (LVNC) with long QT syndrome (LQT) was suspected as the cause of the cardiopulmonary arrest, and treatment with a Î²-blocker and a calcium antagonist was then begun
A genetic screening of LQT-related genes revealed a previously reported heterozygous KCNQ1 mutation
The association of LVNC and LQT is an extremely rare condition, and long-term treatment based on the characteristics of both disorders is required
Also, the association of cardiomyopathy and LQT could become a new clinical entity in the future
